com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com little astronaut pattern pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely  ¼ skein of white  very small amounts of o red o blue o gray  or yarn in the colors you prefer  polyfil gauge is unimportant for this project terms  single_crochet = single_crochet  increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch  decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together  blo = back loops only  leave at least an 8 tail when you bind off each piece you can then use that tail to sew the piece to the little person later on  weave in starting tails as you go note little people are worked in the round when i crochet i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic magic_ring be creative and have fun page 2 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com little helmet row instruction stitches 1 using white 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in next 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 *single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet* around 18 11 *single_crochet in next single_crochet decrease over next 2 single_crochet* around 12 slip_stitch join and bind off leave a tail about 8 long so you can sew the head to the body later on stuff head firmly using polyfill set aside little body row instruction
